page.title: 14WOOLMER PARK(HISTORIC HSE)I
page.content: Mr.Lucas's house has a farm attcached to the house.Mr.Lucas has nine fire place's.If you walk out of a door and turn left there is a chest dated from 1682.There are 3ft thick walls.The bricks in the house are dated from285 years ago.In the library there is a big chanderlier.During the war most of the bits for the chanderlier where lost.Afther the war they could not get the bits for the chanderlier.Before we left we measured how long the kitchen was.It was 38 paces altogether.At one time a man called the Duke of Bridgewater was going to build a canal behind the house.The duke of Bridgewater stayed at Woolmers Park in 1801-1821 while going to join the river Lea with the river Ouse.Over the stream used to be the old water mill. Nine families have lived in the house. That is including Mr.Lucas.]]]]]]]]]
